00047 (ScreenDialogUi, ScreenDialogBase) = loadUiType( Common.uiPath('dia_form_win_many2one.ui') ) 
00048 
00049 class ScreenDialog( QDialog, ScreenDialogUi ):
00050         def __init__(self, parent):
00051                 QWidget.__init__( self, parent )
00052                 ScreenDialogUi.__init__( self )
00053                 self.setupUi( self )
00054 
00055                 self.setMinimumWidth( 800 )
00056                 self.setMinimumHeight( 600 )
00057 
00058                 self.connect( self.pushOk, SIGNAL("clicked()"), self.accepted )
00059                 self.connect( self.pushCancel, SIGNAL("clicked()"), self.reject )
00060                 self.record = None
00061                 self.screen = None
00062                 self._context = {}
00063                 self._domain = []
00064 
00065         def setup(self, model, id=None):
00066                 if self.screen:
00067                         return
00068                 self.group = RecordGroup( model, context=self._context )
00069                 self.group.setDomain( self._domain )
00070                 self.screen = Screen(self)
00071                 self.screen.setRecordGroup( self.group )
00072                 self.screen.setViewTypes( ['form'] )
00073                 if id:
00074                         self.screen.load([id])
00075                 else:
00076                         self.screen.new()
00077                 self.screen.display()
00078                 self.layout().insertWidget( 0, self.screen  )
00079                 self.screen.show()
00080                 
00081         def setAttributes(self, attrs):
00082                 if ('string' in attrs) and attrs['string']:
00083                         self.setWindowTitle( self.windowTitle() + ' - ' + attrs['string'])
00084 
00085         def setContext(self, context):
00086                 self._context = context
00087 
00088         def setDomain(self, domain):
00089                 self._domain = domain
00090 
00091         def accepted( self ):
00092                 self.screen.currentView().store()
00093 
00094                 if self.screen.currentRecord().validate():
00095                         self.accept()
00096                         self.screen.save()
00097                         self.record = self.screen.currentRecord().name()
00098                         self.close()
00099                 else:
00100                         self.reject()

00104 class ManyToOneFieldWidget(AbstractFieldWidget, ManyToOneFieldWidgetUi):
00105         def __init__(self, parent, model, attrs={}):
00106                 AbstractFieldWidget.__init__(self, parent, model, attrs)
00107                 ManyToOneFieldWidgetUi.__init__(self)
00108                 self.setupUi(self)
00109                 
00110                 self.uiText.installEventFilter( self )
00111                 self.connect( self.uiText, SIGNAL( "editingFinished()" ), self.match )
00112                 self.connect( self.pushNew, SIGNAL( "clicked()" ), self.new )
00113                 self.connect( self.pushOpen, SIGNAL( "clicked()" ), self.open )
00114                 self.connect( self.pushClear, SIGNAL( "clicked()" ), self.clear )
00115 
00116                 # Create shortcuts
00117                 self.scNew = QShortcut( self.uiText )
00118                 self.scNew.setKey( Shortcuts.CreateInField )
00119                 self.scNew.setContext( Qt.WidgetShortcut )
00120                 self.connect( self.scNew, SIGNAL('activated()'), self.new )
00121 
00122                 self.scSearch = QShortcut( self.uiText )
00123                 self.scSearch.setKey( Shortcuts.SearchInField )
00124                 self.scSearch.setContext( Qt.WidgetShortcut )
00125                 self.connect( self.scSearch, SIGNAL('activated()'), self.open )
00126 
00127                 self.recordType = attrs['relation']     
00128                 # To build the menu entries we need to query the server so we only make 
00129                 # the call if necessary and only once. Hence with self.menuLoaded we know
00130                 # if we've got it in the 'cache'
00131                 self.menuLoaded = False
00132                 self.newMenuEntries = []
00133                 self.newMenuEntries.append((_('Action'), lambda: self.executeAction('client_action_multi'), False))
00134                 self.newMenuEntries.append((_('Report'), lambda: self.executeAction('client_print_multi'), False))
00135                 self.newMenuEntries.append((None, None, None))
00136 
00137                 if attrs.get('completion',False):
00138                         ids = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attrs['relation'], 'name_search', '', [], 'ilike', {}, False)
00139                         if ids:
00140                                 self.loadCompletion( ids, attrs )
00141 
00142         def clear( self ):
00143                 # As the 'clear' button might modify the model we need to be sure all other fields/widgets
00144                 # have been stored in the model. Otherwise the recordChanged() triggered by modifying
00145                 # the parent model could make us lose changes.
00146                 self.view.store()
00147 
00148                 if self.record:
00149                         self.record.setValue( self.name, False )
00150                 self.uiText.clear()
00151                 self.pushOpen.setIcon( QIcon( ":/images/find.png"))
00152 
00153         def loadCompletion(self,ids,attrs):
00154                 self.completion = QCompleter()
00155                 self.completion.setCaseSensitivity( Qt.CaseInsensitive )
00156                 self.uiText.setCompleter( self.completion )
00157                 liststore = []
00158                 for i,word in enumerate( ids ):
00159                         if word[1][0] == '[':
00160                                 i = word[1].find( ']')
00161                                 s = word[1][1:i]
00162                                 s2 = word[1][i+2:]
00163                                 liststore.append( s2 )
00164                         else:
00165                                 liststore.append( word[1] )
00166                 self.completion.setModel( QStringListModel( liststore ) )
00167                 self.completion.setCompletionColumn( 0 )
00168 
00169         def setReadOnly(self, value):
00170                 self.uiText.setEnabled( not value )
00171                 self.pushNew.setEnabled( not value )
00172                 self.pushClear.setEnabled( not value )
00173                 self.pushOpen.setEnabled( not value )
00174 
00175         def colorWidget(self):
00176                 return self.uiText
00177 
00178         def match(self):
00179                 if not self.record:
00180                         return
00181                 name = unicode( self.uiText.text() )
00182                 if name.strip() == '':
00183                         self.record.setValue( self.name, False )                        
00184                         self.showValue()
00185                         return
00186                 if name == self.record.value(self.name):
00187                         return
00188                 self.search( name )
00189 
00190         def open(self):
00191                 # As the 'open' button might modify the model we need to be sure all other fields/widgets
00192                 # have been stored in the model. Otherwise the recordChanged() triggered by modifying
00193                 # the parent model could make us lose changes.
00194                 self.view.store()
00195 
00196                 if self.record.value(self.name):
00197                         # If Control Key is pressed when the open button is clicked
00198                         # the record will be opened in a new tab. Otherwise it's opened
00199                         # in a new modal dialog.
00200                         if QApplication.keyboardModifiers() & Qt.ControlModifier:
00201                                 model = self.attrs['relation']
00202                                 id = self.record.get()[self.name]
00203                                 Api.instance.createWindow(False, model, id, [], 'form', mode='form,tree')
00204                         else:   
00205                                 dialog = ScreenDialog( self )
00206                                 dialog.setAttributes( self.attrs )
00207                                 dialog.setup( self.attrs['relation'], self.record.get()[self.name] )
00208                                 if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00209                                         self.record.setValue(self.name, dialog.record)
00210                                         self.display()
00211                 else:
00212                         self.search('')
00213 
00214         # This function searches the given name within the available records. If none or more than
00215         # one possible name matches the search dialog is shown. If only one matches we set the
00216         # value and don't even show the search dialog. This is also true if the function is called
00217         # with "name=''" and only one record exists in the database (hence the call from open())
00218         def search(self, name):
00219                 domain = self.record.domain( self.name )
00220                 context = self.record.context()
00221                 ids = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attrs['relation'], 'name_search', name, domain, 'ilike', context, False)
00222                 if ids and len(ids)==1:
00223                         self.record.setValue( self.name, ids[0] )
00224                         self.display()
00225                 else:
00226                         dialog = SearchDialog(self.attrs['relation'], sel_multi=False, ids=[x[0] for x in ids], context=context, domain=domain)
00227                         if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted and dialog.result:
00228                                 id = dialog.result[0]
00229                                 name = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attrs['relation'], 'name_get', [id], Rpc.session.context)[0]
00230                                 self.record.setValue(self.name, name)
00231                                 self.display()
00232 
00233         def new(self):
00234                 dialog = ScreenDialog(self)
00235                 dialog.setAttributes( self.attrs )
00236                 dialog.setContext( self.record.fieldContext( self.name ) )
00237                 dialog.setDomain( self.record.domain(self.name) )
00238                 dialog.setup( self.attrs['relation'] )
00239                 if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00240                         self.record.setValue(self.name, dialog.record)
00241                         self.display()
00242 
00243         def store(self):
00244                 # No update of the model, the model is updated in real time 
00245                 pass
00246 
00247         def reset(self):
00248                 self.uiText.clear()
00249                 
00250         def showValue(self):
00251                 res = self.record.value(self.name)
00252                 if res:
00253                         self.uiText.setText( res )
00254                         self.pushOpen.setIcon( QIcon( ":/images/folder.png"))
00255                         # pushOpen will always be enabled if it has to open an existing
00256                         # element
00257                         self.pushOpen.setEnabled( True )
00258                 else:
00259                         self.uiText.clear()
00260                         self.pushOpen.setIcon( QIcon( ":/images/find.png"))
00261                         # pushOpen won't be enabled if it is to find an element
00262                         self.pushOpen.setEnabled( not self.isReadOnly() )
00263                         
00264 
00265         def menuEntries(self):
00266                 if not self.menuLoaded:
00267                         related = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.values', 'get', 'action', 'client_action_relate', [(self.recordType, False)], False, Rpc.session.context)
00268                         actions = [x[2] for x in related]
00269                         for action in actions:
00270                                 f = lambda action: lambda: self.executeRelation(action)
00271                                 self.newMenuEntries.append(('... '+ action['name'], f(action), False))
00272                         self.menuLoaded = True
00273 
00274                 # Set enabled/disabled values
00275                 value = self.record.value(self.name)
00276                 if value:
00277                         value = True
00278                 else:
00279                         value = False
00280                 currentEntries = []
00281                 for x in self.newMenuEntries:
00282                         currentEntries.append( (x[0], x[1], value) )
00283                 return currentEntries
00284 
00285         def executeRelation(self, action):
00286                 id = self.record.get()[self.name]
00287                 group = RecordGroup( self.attrs['relation'] )
00288                 group.load( [id] )
00289                 record = group.modelByIndex( 0 )
00290                 action['domain'] = record.evaluateExpression( action['domain'], check_load=False)
00291                 action['context'] = str( record.evaluateExpression( action['context'], check_load=False) )
00292                 Api.instance.executeAction( action )
00293 
00294         def executeAction(self, type):
00295                 id = self.record.id
00296                 Api.instance.executeKeyword(type, {'model':self.recordType, 'id': id or False, 'ids':[id], 'report_type': 'pdf'})
00297 
00298 class ManyToOneFieldDelegate( AbstractFieldDelegate ):
00299         def __init__(self, parent, attributes):
00300                 AbstractFieldDelegate.__init__(self, parent, attributes)
00301                 self.currentIndex = None
00302                 self.currentEditor = None
00303                 self.currentValue = None
00304                 self.recordType = attributes['relation']        
00305 
00306         def menuEntries(self, record):
00307                 newMenuEntries = []
00308                 newMenuEntries.append((_('Action'), lambda: self.executeAction(record, 'client_action_multi'), False))
00309                 newMenuEntries.append((_('Report'), lambda: self.executeAction(record, 'client_print_multi'), False))
00310                 newMenuEntries.append((None, None, None))
00311                 related = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', 'ir.values', 'get', 'action', 'client_action_relate', [(self.recordType, False)], False, Rpc.session.context)
00312                 actions = [x[2] for x in related]
00313                 for action in actions:
00314                         f = lambda action: lambda: self.executeRelation(record, action)
00315                         newMenuEntries.append(('... '+ action['name'], f(action), False))
00316 
00317                 # Set enabled/disabled values
00318                 value = record.value(self.name)
00319                 if value:
00320                         value = True
00321                 else:
00322                         value = False
00323                 currentEntries = []
00324                 for x in newMenuEntries:
00325                         currentEntries.append( (x[0], x[1], value) )
00326                 return currentEntries
00327 
00328         def executeRelation(self, record, action):
00329                 id = record.get()[self.name]
00330                 group = RecordGroup( self.attributes['relation'] )
00331                 group.load( [id] )
00332                 record = group.modelByIndex( 0 )
00333                 action['domain'] = record.evaluateExpression( action['domain'], check_load=False)
00334                 action['context'] = str( record.evaluateExpression( action['context'], check_load=False) )
00335                 Api.instance.executeAction( action )
00336 
00337         def executeAction(self, record, type):
00338                 id = record.id
00339                 Api.instance.executeKeyword(type, {'model':self.recordType, 'id': id or False, 'ids':[id], 'report_type': 'pdf'})
00340 
00341         def createEditor(self, parent, option, index):
00342                 widget = AbstractFieldDelegate.createEditor(self, parent, option, index)
00343                 if widget:
00344                         # Create shortcuts
00345                         self.scNew = QShortcut( widget )
00346                         self.scNew.setContext( Qt.WidgetShortcut )
00347                         self.scNew.setKey( Shortcuts.CreateInField )
00348                         self.connect( self.scNew, SIGNAL('activated()'), self.new )
00349 
00350                         self.scSearch = QShortcut( widget )
00351                         self.scSearch.setContext( Qt.WidgetShortcut )
00352                         self.scSearch.setKey( Shortcuts.SearchInField )
00353                         self.connect( self.scSearch, SIGNAL('activated()'), self.open )
00354                 self.currentEditor = widget
00355                 # We expect a KooModel here
00356                 self.record = index.model().recordFromIndex( index )
00357                 return widget
00358 
00359         def open(self):
00360                 # As the 'open' button might modify the model we need to be sure all other fields/widgets
00361                 # have been stored in the model. Otherwise the recordChanged() triggered by modifying
00362                 # the parent model could make us lose changes.
00363                 #self.view.store()
00364 
00365                 if self.record.value(self.name):
00366                         # If Control Key is pressed when the open button is clicked
00367                         # the record will be opened in a new tab. Otherwise it's opened
00368                         # in a new modal dialog.
00369                         if QApplication.keyboardModifiers() & Qt.ControlModifier:
00370                                 model = self.attributes['relation']
00371                                 id = self.record.get()[self.name]
00372                                 Api.instance.createWindow(False, model, id, [], 'form', mode='form,tree')
00373                         else:   
00374                                 dialog = ScreenDialog( self.currentEditor )
00375                                 dialog.setAttributes( self.attributes )
00376                                 dialog.setup( self.attributes['relation'], self.record.get()[self.name] )
00377                                 if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00378                                         self.record.setValue(self.name, dialog.record)
00379                 else:
00380                         self.search('')
00381 
00382         # This function searches the given name within the available records. If none or more than
00383         # one possible name matches the search dialog is shown. If only one matches we set the
00384         # value and don't even show the search dialog. This is also true if the function is called
00385         # with "name=''" and only one record exists in the database (hence the call from open())
00386         def search(self, name):
00387                 domain = self.record.domain( self.name )
00388                 context = self.record.context()
00389                 ids = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attributes['relation'], 'name_search', name, domain, 'ilike', context, False)
00390                 if ids and len(ids)==1:
00391                         self.record.setValue( self.name, ids[0] )
00392                 else:
00393                         dialog = SearchDialog(self.attributes['relation'], sel_multi=False, ids=[x[0] for x in ids], context=context, domain=domain)
00394                         if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted and dialog.result:
00395                                 id = dialog.result[0]
00396                                 name = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attributes['relation'], 'name_get', [id], Rpc.session.context)[0]
00397                                 self.record.setValue(self.name, name)
00398 
00399         def new(self):
00400                 dialog = ScreenDialog( self.currentEditor )
00401                 dialog.setAttributes( self.attributes )
00402                 dialog.setContext( self.record.fieldContext( self.name ) )
00403                 dialog.setDomain( self.record.domain(self.name) )
00404                 dialog.setup( self.attributes['relation'] )
00405                 if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted:
00406                         if self.currentIndex and self.currentIndex.isValid():
00407                                 self.record.setValue(self.name, dialog.record)
00408 
00409         def setModelData(self, editor, kooModel, index):
00410                 # We expect a KooModel here
00411                 model = kooModel.recordFromIndex( index )
00412 
00413                 if not unicode(editor.text()):
00414                         model.setValue( self.name, False )
00415                         return
00416 
00417                 if unicode( kooModel.data( index, Qt.DisplayRole ).toString() ) == unicode( editor.text() ):
00418                         return
00419 
00420                 domain = model.domain( self.name )
00421                 context = model.context()
00422                 ids = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attributes['relation'], 'name_search', unicode( editor.text() ), domain, 'ilike', context, False)
00423                 if ids and len(ids)==1:
00424                         model.setValue( self.name, ids[0] )
00425                 else:
00426                         dialog = SearchDialog(self.attributes['relation'], sel_multi=False, ids=[x[0] for x in ids], context=context, domain=domain)
00427                         if dialog.exec_() == QDialog.Accepted and dialog.result:
00428                                 id = dialog.result[0]
00429                                 name = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.attributes['relation'], 'name_get', [id], Rpc.session.context)[0]
00430                                 
00431                                 # Directly set the value to the model. There's no need to
00432                                 # use setData() but we mainly want to workaround a bug in
00433                                 # PyQt 4.4.3 and 4.4.4.
00434                                 #value = [ QVariant( name[0] ), QVariant( name[1] ) ]
00435                                 #kooModel.setData( index, QVariant( value ), Qt.EditRole )
00436                                 model.setValue( self.name, name )
